text: Coming from a Greek background and community, this place is as good as it gets in Las Vegas! Excellent and authentic food! Love the staff! Can't wait till next time!

We are so happy to have found this place!  My husband is from Greece and we are always trying to find authentic Greek food in Las Vegas.  After Opa closed years ago, we haven't been able to find the real deal...UNTIL NOW!  It's so nice to see him connect with others from his country (the fabulous Owner and Chef) and the food tastes just like it does in my mother-in-law's tiny kitchen in Greece.  Everything we have tasted thus far is exquisite, which lead us back there twice in one week.

My family and I are Greek from Samos and are always looking for a fantastic greek restaurant in Las Vegas. We finally found it! This place is traditional in its' presentation and encompasses the full flavors I grew up with. If you want true FRESH greek food, this is the place. They even have our favorite Retsina (Greek wine). The entire experience was more than expected. They're fairly new so we were lucky enough to not have a wait and it's tucked into Sun City Summerlin so it truly is a hidden gem. Come with an open mind and an adventurous pallette!

Keeps getting better each time we eat at Mykonos. This last time we had fish dishes and it was the whole fish which they will debone for you at the table. It was moist, fresh with flavor. Will have again. Wonderful to find fresh whole (with the head on it - that's the whole fish. Good selection of greek wines now, much appreciated.

My dad and I liked Mykonos so much after our first visit we went back again a couple of day later. We ordered off the Early Bird menu the first time, which has several entrees that come with soup or salad and are only $9.50. The avgolemono soup was yummy, as was my huge portion of half chicken. 

Our second visit, I stuck with appetizers. The tzatziki was so delicious it made a convert out of my Dad, who had never liked it before. The chef told us that's because they make it from yogurt from Greece so it's a high quality, true Greek yogurt. The spanokopita was tasty but the pastry was kind of tough. Maybe it had been microwaved?

The service was excellent and the waitress gave us delicious free Greek butter cookies for dessert. Dad ordered the baklava with the sweet grape sauce on the side. I enjoyed the tiny bite he shared with me.
Branzino whole fish simply prepared with olive oil and lemon, was amazing . "BEST GREEK RESTAURANT IN LAS VEGAS "

WOW, the best Greek food we've had since we left Detroit! Started with Saganaki, octupus and loukaniko, again WOW! The grillednoctupus was served over a bed of pureed Fava beans, scrumptious! The entrees were equally amazing!! If you are looking for true, authentic,  Greek cuisine, this is the place!!
truly takes me back to the islands of Greece!  Authentic Greek cuisine, just like my grandma used to make!

We had a wonderful family dinner at Mykonos on Saturday night. Great food, very pleasant atmosphere, and two of the most gracious, friendly, and informative hosts you could imagine.

Starting with the saganaki and fresh pita, we were impressed. The feta on the Greek romaine salad was creamy and not overly salty, the herbs and oil in the dressing complemented the lettuce very well. Entrees included the beef tips, lamb chops, shrimp, and chicken souvlaki. 

Each dish was expertly prepared and had a depth of flavors that showcased the main ingredient. Fruit with the shrimp was a brilliant touch. The sauce with the beef tips was rich but never overpowered the meat. Lamb chops were grilled to perfection and served over arugula with a bright fresh sauce that was enjoyable to the last drop. The souvlaki was traditional, very well seasoned, and accompanied by fresh vegetables. Everyone ordered rice as a side and agreed that it was a great choice.

Excellent wines - be adventurous and try the Greek selections - are affordable by the glass or the bottle. Ask about a dessert wine for a special treat.

As for our experience, we were treated extremely well. Our hosts were engaging, attentive, fun, and created a memorable evening for us. Helen was sweet and understanding, and Chef Sakis helped with everything from the wine selection to a Greek geography lesson that we really appreciated. 

For authentic Greek food, an amazing evening, and a good feeling that lasts long after you leave the restaurant, don't miss Mykonos!

Well, I am sorry Helen of Mykonos restaurant didn't appreciate my review.  I also do not work for any restaurant, Greek or otherwise, but just give my honest opinion based of my experience.  One of the things we do (or most of us do) on Yelp is give an honest opinion of the restaurants we frequent.  I have many reviews on Yelp, some good, some not so good, but all of them honest.  I have spent a lot of time in Greece, I cook Greek food, and have frequented many Greek restaurants in Las Vegas and  other parts of the country.  I based my opinion on that history, and found Mykonos lacking compared to other places I have tried.  But it is attractive and service was attentive , so I hope they make a success of their business.

Very authentic Greek Cuisine - the service was excellent as was the lamb shank! My husband had the battered cod - the fish was very good but the batter was a bit too salty. His dish came w/beets & we agree they were delicious! I had a side of Greek potatoes & I found the oregano seasoning too strong. Again these dishes are very authentic so this is a matter of my personal taste.  We had the calamari & it was good, not the best we've ever had but something we would order again. We tried the Greek Mythos Beer & we both enjoyed that! It's a bit pricey $90 w/tip! Overall it was a good dining experience - stop by if you are in the neighborhood - maybe for lunch if you are dining on a budget!

I was craving for some Greek food and thought to try this place after seeing all the good reviews; however, it was a huge mistake! The only people in the restaurant was a couple and my family during dinner. The lack of people should have given me a clue to turn around and eat elsewhere.
2 of the 6 items we tried to order, they did not have. How can they not have a half a roasted chicken or some pork chops? So, my son ended up ordering chicken kebab instead and because they did not have any pork chops, I ended up ordering chicken kebab as well.
The food was horrendous! The $17 grilled octopus appetizer was burnt and very salty. I ended up eating it so as not to waste my $17. My husband's boiled salad was so nasty!! The chef insisted that everyone who tried this salad, they end up ordering again...I highly doubt that! My chicken kebab was soaked in oil and was very sour. It seemed like the chef just poured a bunch of olive oil on top of the chicken and the rice it came with and called it a day. The only good thing they had was my son's Greek salad, which I ended up eating instead of the chicken kebab.
I do have to say that service was great. But, it doesn't make up for the fact that the food was horrible. I don't think I'll ever recommend this place to anyone.

My friends and I ate lunch at Mykonos last Friday.  It was wonderful!  The service and food were excellent!  As wives of Greek and Greek Cypriot husbands we know good Greek food.  Looking forward to more good Greek food in the near future.

Visiting my Mom here in Sun City and decided to try the new Greek place up the street. I pulled in and asked my wife to grab a menu so we could look at it. The menu was much more than expected so we grabbed Mom out of the car and went in and had a seat. The food was amazing and so was the service. This is a must try if you like Greek food.  My wife had a piece of white fish that was boned at our table, she selected the potatoes to go with it, excellent. My Mom had a shrimp plate with fruit, amazing, what flavor!  Me, I had the special, and I can not tell you the name of it, but man was it good. This will be my first 5 star rating ever and I will tell you why. Along with the great food and fantastic service the price was more than reasonable.  I mean the dinner special was only 10.00 dollars.
If you like Greek food this is a must try.  When I visit Vegas I will try to dine there

This cozy restsurant in Summerlin is under a new ownership and the food is delicious. The atmosphere is quiet and more upscale than casual. I tried the special of the day, roasted leg of lamb. It was prepared to perfection and the size of the dish was giant. It can easily feed two people, but I managed to finish it by myself (because I have bigger"talent" than most people.)

Mykonos offers a great selection of high-end Greek wine and beers. Ouzo is coming soon. 

At the end the friendly owner surprised me with a small Greek desert on the house. 

I'll be back with my friends soon.
Absolute best Greek that we have had across many states in US.  Mousaka and Greek salad were authentic and delicious.  Owner and his wife were gracious and welcoming.

Finally a place that all my coworkers can agree on for lunch! We have never had a bad meal here, or anything less than lovely service. The spanakopita and feta with olives are our absolute must. We always have one person on a 'diet', and they are always happy to accommodate. Some day soon I'll have to try this place for dinner.

This restaurant is located in Summerlin near the Palm Valley Golf Course in Sun City.  It has authentic food, very fresh.  We tried the grilled octopus (outstanding), a lamb kebob (souvlaki), gyros and the egg lemon soup.  All were really great!  I hope the neighborhood discovers it - it is as good as the Greek Town restaurants we are familiar with in Chicago.  They are currently waiting for their beer and wine license.

We had dinner there last night  the place is nicely decorated  the food was very good  service not so good.  For a business starting out  service needs to pick up- we also asked for a take out menu and was told all is on line- not sure what anyone does if they do not have access on line  I guess not to call them for an order.

5 Reasons why Mykonos deserves 5 stars:

1. Food was excellent- We ordered gyros, spanikopita, calamari, & pasticcio. All were delicious. 
2. Helen, the owner, was supremely personable and genuine.
3. Friendly, quick service 
4. Authentic, clean atmosphere
5. Best Baklava I've ever had!

Tucked away in a tiny office strip in, of all places, Sun City Summerlin, is one of the Valley's best restaurants and clearly the best Greek food I have found in Las Vegas. Everything is made from scratch and made with love. In addition to the wonderful favorites like lamb or chicken souvlaki, lamb chops, spanakopita, dolmades (the best I have ever tasted - served hot) tzatziki, etc. there are several wonderful dishes I have never heard of before. Among the best  a diced eggplant appetizer called maritzanosalata, a drizzled sweet beet salad, various wonderful spaghettis, and Helen's Shrimp Heaven, grilled shrimp with sautéed fruit and citrus sauce served over arugula. Helen, the owner is delightful and welcoming, and the chef will be happy to come out and discuss any special needs or desires with you. My only (tiny) negative is that because this used to be a crappy breakfast cafe, there is only a high counter (now supporting an attractive display of wines) separating the kitchen from the dining area. I am not a wine lover, but the wine selection seems extensive and should please those who find vino a necessity with a fine meal. And a very fine meal it is, finished, if you have room, with a wonderful baklava or other dessert that wold seem equally as good. And did I mention that the pita is homemade and freshly baked for your table. We live around the corner so this is a neighborhood place for us, but if you live in Henderson or Boulder City or are on vacation or business on the Strip, it's worth the drive and effort to find Mykonos. If you like Greek food you won't be disappointed.

You've tasted the tapas at Jose Andres' Jaleo at The Cosmopolitan.

You've ciao-ed and chowed at Mario Batali's B+B Ristorante at the Venetian.

You still can't pronounce his name, but you now know why Joel Robuchon was given the title "Chef of the Century" by the Gault Millau -- the illustrious French restaurant guide, whose name you can't pronounce either.

You've eaten all the unreal food that increasingly is why people travel to this unreal city. So when you're ready to skip the strip and go local, make your way to Summerlin, the planned community that Howard Hughes's heirs built at the edge of the Spring Mountains and Red Rock Canyon. 

In a shopping center on Sun City Boulevard, you'll find the unexpected Mykonos restaurant. On a business trip last year, my husband and I ate dinner at the restaurant and left wishing we had brought a suitcase to fill with moussaka and baklava with sweet grape sauce. 

Tyche, the Greek goddess of fortune and luck, favored us with a return business trip to Las Vegas this year, and we headed to Mykonos with a colleague for dinner. With the goddess's favor, we arrived in time for the Early Bird menu. 

To start, my husband and I ordered avgolemono: chicken, lemon and rice soup. It was mother food, hot and homey. Our colleague ordered choriatiki, a composed salad that included dolmades (stuffed grape leaves). 

For entrees, our colleague and I chose the lamb souvlaki (chunks of grilled lamb, green peppers and onions), served on a bed of rice mixed with orzo and with triangles of grilled, buttered pita. It was cooked the way I had asked the server: pink. My husband ordered the moussaka, served with rice and orzo and grilled pita triangles. Light -- yes, not like a Parthenon slab.

We had no room for dessert, but we couldn't resist ordering it. Karidopita, walnut cake with cinnamon and sugar syrup, for my husband and bakalava for me and our colleague. You would think that baklava doesn't need "finishing" with orange and cinnamon-infused honey and sweet grape sauce. But it does, and we finished it. 

The wine list has many Greek gems. Order a bottle or two -- it's cheap and cheerful.

The Mykonos murals on the side walls add to the ambiance. But the gigantic television set hanging from the back wall is about as appealing as Medusa.

Kristela Colloku is charming. Chef Frank Difloe is a big man -- in stature and talent. And then there is Chef Maurice, an African-American who played professional basketball in Greece for two years, speaks the language, and told me that the Greeks taught him how to live. Opa!

The next evening, Tyche favored us with a return to Mykonos. But she didn't favor us at the hotel casino.

My husband & I have been to this restaurant many times over the last few months. The food is delicious and the service is impeccable. The owners are great, hands-on people, who provide a personal touch.
My wife and I just had lunch at Mykonos. The owner is super nice. The shaved Lamb/beef mix Gyros was out of this world good. Nice clean restaurant. We definitely will return for more.

Had a great early dinner this past weekend. The 5 of us ended up ordering differently so we were exposed to a variety of the menu offerings. The Tzaziki spread was very authentic and the pork chop entree was the best I've had anywhere. Unusual but extremely tasty spinach pie and great beef souvlaki! All portions very generous and prices offer great value.  Nicole provided excellent and fast service. Congrats to new Chef Owner Frank Difloe - we'll be back!!!!

What a delicious find! I love this place! Authentic Greek cuisine like my mom and Baba used to cook while I was growing up! 10 stars! 
OPA!

Just looking for a greek salad and found this place. OMG -This restaurant is the best. We flipped over the tziki (even though I spelled it wrong) , the salmon was mouthwatering and my gyro was HUGH. Helen made our experience and it will definitely be our required stop whenever we are in town. Thank you, you made our golf day even better - We Will Be Back !!!!!!!

Sooooo good!  Two of us went for lunch today -- ordered moussaka and a traditional Greek salad so we could both have some of each. Absolutely delicious! And considering the excellent service, reasonable pricing and convenient location, we are sure to be back.  Lots more on the menu we'd like to try.

The octopus appetizer is probably the best I've had, very tender and delicious Lamb pasta entree (can't remember name) is highly recommended! Everything was fresh and authentic Greek, it's easy to see this restaurant stands out from most in terms of authenticity. Service was outstanding as well. They earned the 5 stars

Me and my Greek family (born in Greece) came here for my moms birthday. The food was authentic and very well prepared. We enjoyed ourselves immensely. Helen (owner) was so very pleasant and such a great hostess, it made me feel like I was in Greece. Denny the chef prepared and explained his passion for the food and the presentation of the meal. I will return every time I am in the area. I think I have tasted the best Octopus in history.
Superb!

Prayers and well wishes for Chef/Owner Frank who was in a car accident recently. They should be re-opened as soon as he's back in action! Great food & great place! Look forward to his return! Baklava is amazing!
Hummus with warm pita bread and an order of calamari was a great start. The pasta with tiger shrimp was fabulous, and generous enough to share. Of course, had to try the baklava!!!
Love this place! Great food. The flavors are phenomenal. The owner and chef Frank is the greatest host and cook. This is our new favorite place! Great for date night and family!
The BEST service! The BEST Greek food! Family owned. Very welcoming and comfortable environment! You have to come and check it out. You won't be disappointed.

Seriously one of the worst meals in our lives.  The first clue should have been the place was completely empty on a Saturday night at 6:30pm, the staff was staring out of the window wondering when the first person sucker would walk in.  I ordered pan fried cod with some kind of mashed potatoes and beet salad.  17.00 for this. You would expect a pretty fresh and hot meal.  Not the case.  
Beets were anything but a salad maybe sliced from the can and placed on the plate.  Not really what I would call salad.  Speaking of salad. There was a bit of salad on the plate. Fresh. No I wouldn't call it fresh by any means.  Brown and turning is more like it. A space filler is what it was. Mashed potatoes with garlic. ICE COLD. Told them to heat it up waiters says oh sorry about that then comes back and says that's not mashed potatoes there supposed to be cold. Really and you work here and didn't know that. What would you call a potato that has been pulverized. Looks mashed to me.   Alright on my the pan fried cod. Should be nice and light flakey warm and FRESH. hahaha that's where they really screwed up.   SOGGY. Overcooked frozen fish was like chewing a tough steak with no flavor  absolutely inedible.   The second meal salmon special.  Oh it was special alright.  23.00 on sale for 16. About a 3.00 piece of frozen overcooked tough salmon is what it really was.  A side of reheated God knows how many times potatoes and all of this floating in a nice pile of some sort of grease / oil whatever.  Waiters asks how's your fish I said inedible overcooked soggy and anything but fresh. His response oh sorry to hear that. Would you like to order desert.  Lmao. Seriously did you not just hear what we said.  And another tip. Change the table clothes.  The fresh food stains make it really unappealing to sit there and eat.  So here we are $45.00 later and both of us are sick to our stomachs thinking we caught something .  I guess we will find out in a few hours.  What a disgrace !!!  I wondered how there could be so many 4-5 star reviews
And then get served this slop.  Makes you wonder who wrote those reviews.  I hope we get food poisoning because then you will be on the news with the health district shining a microscope up your rear

UPDATE. : We are now receiving threatening messages from the owners husband.  I guess they think 2 cases of food poisoning is something to joke about.

**************** YOU GAVE US FOOD POISONING  **********************

HOW MANY OTHER WAYS DO WE HAVE TO SAY THIS BEFORE YOU FIGURE OUT THAT YOU ARE MAKING PEOPLE SICK WITH YOUR FOOD...

Good these people should have been closed a long time ago.   Karma gotcha huh.

Why didn't I come here sooner?!  Delicious, authentic Greek cuisine, it's absolutely divine.  We ordered some basic items, gyro platter, lamb chops, salad and everything was delicious.  We decided to take a chance on the shrimp spaghetti and I'm so glad we did!  The sauce was so complex with cinnamon and other herbs.  This is truly a gem of a place and I hope it stays open forever.  The chef came out at the end of our meal and we learned he lived and studied in Greece.  You need to try this place.
I have to say this is the best Greek food I've had In Las Vegas. The kataifi was exceptional! This is a new mom and pop restaurant. Everything is made with so much love.

This place is absolutely lovely. Authentic Greek cuisine and as someone that is Greek and has lived there, I should know :) The owners were so sweet, they gifted us their favorite dish on the menu (shrimp over prunes and arugula, amazing!) in honor of our first visit to their restaurant. Our server was polite and attentive. The atmosphere was charming. Definitely worth the drive across town!

Absolutely the best Greek food since Chicago!   High quality & absolutely everything is homemade!  Can't wait to go back Owners are awesome!  It's right in Sun City! ! They haven't been open that long so please treat yourself to a great Lunch or Dinner! Even have homemade desserts!
The food is delish and authentic and the cook actually came from the kitchen to greet our table! Will definitely revisit this quaint Greek eatery!

Best Greek/Mediterranean food I've had in Las Vegas, and I think I've had it all! The mezze plate was turkey platter awesomeness, and the fish roe sauce was amazing. Sausage was delicious, and the cheese was great and ample. The baba/hummus/tatziki all delicious. Lamb and meatballs very tasty. The pictures tell the story, Cupcake.
The best Greek cheeseburger in Vegas!!!! All good is fresh, nothing frozen and everything made from scratch. Gotta give them a try.
Great food and excellent service. Loved the chicken gyro plate. The portion was huge and it was really tasty. The server was attentive and very nice. I will definitely come back here again.

We started with Greek style calamari, followed by lamb gyros and Greek rice And ended with baklava for desert!

Service was friendly and attentive!  We went for a late lunch, so not too many other diners at the time.  The restaurant was clean and Greek themed, of course.

We had a nice house Cabernet that was not overly priced with our lunch.

The pita bread was by far the best that I ever ate!  It was freshly baked, soft and flavorful, but firm enough to handle the nice sized slabs of lamb in the gyro.  Very yummy!  The rice was bland, so I won't choose it next time, but they have other options available to go along with the gyro.  It typically comes with fries, but next time I'll go for a small Greek salad to accompany the gyro.  They have many selections on their menu, but I grade Greek restaurants on the quality of their gyros, first.

Best Greek food in the valley. The hummus, Greek salad, shrimp saganaki and salmon, all delicious!!
Definitely worth a visit!

The staff was very nice and service was fast! We went there on a Friday night and it wasn't too busy. The Chiriatiki Salad was delicious with a nice  oil and red wine vinegar dressing and authentic Greek feta cheese. We also had pita bread that was nice and warm. The hummus was on the thick side but tasty. We also ordered the Moussaka that was good. I've never had it before so there's really nothing to compare it to- I would like to come back here again and explore then menu!
The delivery service is fast and convenient and the dishes remind me of Greece! Try it!

I am new to the area and stopped here yesterday for lunch. I thought the food was excellent - I practically inhaled it! I got the chicken gyro which came with a big side of rice, which was also delicious! The service was fast and friendly. I will definitely come here often!

Great food. Great price. Hubby had beef tips over rice. I had lamb kabobs. EXCELLENT FOOD. I highly recommend this place. We got to do a taste test on the wine we chose. Lovely evening out and priced very well.

When I walked in the front door I was not so sure about this place.  As soon as I sat down I was greeted by the nicest and welcoming restaurant owners that I have ever met.  Their hospitality was amazing and their love and sense of pride for this restaurant just make it a more welcoming place to be. Everything that I ate was absolutely delicious and I would definitely come back next time I am in town and would recommend this to others without a doubt!

The gyro dinner was excellent, all the ingredients served kind of like a pizza rather than a sandwich.

I ordered baklava. It disappointed me because of the fruit sauce poured over it which detracted from the flavors of honey and butter for which I love the dessert. But I am convinced that under that sauce is one of the best baklavas I have ever had. Next time Ill ask them to leave off the sauce.  

The gyro earned my 5-star rating.

Nestled into the sleepy Sun City area is a new Greek restaurant- lunch menu has great well-priced specials and dinner menu has more traditional fare, but they also offer breakfast! Check their website for discount coupons and specials before you go.

STEAK SANDWICH is packed with grilled veggies, a perfectly-juicy medium-rare steak, and feta: simple and tasty. Side choice of salad is a mix of cucumbers, green bell peppers, red onion, tomato, and olives, with olive oil and more feta.
MYKONOS BURGER has tzatziki, feta, and more of the grilled veggies: burger itself was a messy fall-apart version better eaten with a fork. Bun was dry and fell apart pretty quick, may need to find a different option. Side of greek fries was topped with herbs, simple and tasty. 
AVGOLEMONO is the best my BF has had- tart, thick, lemony, good amount of chicken, ample rice, solid and balanced flavor. Cup size is large, bowl is probably enough for an entrée.
DESSERT Plate had baklava with a hint of cinnamon and another sweet pastry, good contrasting flavors and textures, liked the small portion- didn't feel overly indulgent.

Good pricing, very friendly service, chef came out to check on us. Love the bright and airy location with several windows and giant photos of the Greek coastline. No alcohol license yet, beer and wine to come.

EDIT: Dropping my rating due in large part to the decline in service. Just look at the manager Helen's rude and condescending responses to other low reviews. If that's the attitude I can look forward to now that the honeymoon period is over, I won't be back.

I went back for a second visit to Mykonos Greek Cuisine and had completely the opposite experience!  The restaurant was busy but we still received the friendly, attentive service that all the guests did.  I am an Avgolemono soup fan and I decided to try a cup.  It had a very fresh lemony flavor that came with some grilled pita pieces.  It was fantastic.  I ordered the pasticio and my dining companion ordered the moussaka. I experienced a fresh, homemade dish that was so good I had to finish the huge portion.  The moussaka was the same, fresh, homemade and to die for!  What makes Mykonos even better for me is that it is not on the Strip or in a mall, it is in a small center a short drive from Summerlin which makes it an easy stop for lunch or dinner!

Not a good place to eat. The food is tasty, but it is expensive and the owners are not friendly. I saw one of them belittle a waitress in front of everyone! When we came to eat here, they were still fairly new, and I understand that all new places have kinks to work out. I got the pork gyro, which was supposed to have lamb, but did not because of a miscommunication with the waitress. I really enjoyed the lemon soup, it was probably the best I've had. I was definately going to come back and give them another shot. But sadly the next time they harassed my grandma about MY review. She was super uncomfortable and asked if she should leave. The owners told her no of course because they wanted the money. I felt so bad for her. A paying customer shouldn't be treated badly over a Yelp review that was written by someone else. A 3 star review at that. They are not nice people and for that reason I won't be back.

This was one of the best restaurants I have been to in a long time.  The food and service was simply amazing.  We ordered the fresh fish of the day which was sea bass. It was so darn tasty and cooked to perfection.  The chef, Dennis delivered our entrees with a smile and answered any questions that we should have. I told him I was going to Santorini, Greece the following week
And he had lots of helpful suggestions for me. He also sent over a complimentary cocktail.  I will be eating there on a regular basis and look forward to live music on Thursday.  Cheers

Great food, I had the salmon lunch which came with rice for 15 bucks. A little pricey for lunch but the food was amazing so the price didn't bother me that much. The salmon was cooked perfectly and the rice had a citrus flavor that was great. My wife had a pork gyro with fries also very good. Highly recommend this place!

Love the food, very quant not loud. Food was great, my husband said it was like how his mom would cook for him. Very authentic Greek food we had lamb chops, authentic Greek salad and the burger with a side of the Taziki cucumber yogurt sauce. They made our Valentines dinner special. Be sure to call for a reservation and give them a try. Looking forward to some more Baklava with coffee on the patio next. Almost forgot mmmm the soup

Really cute little restaurant in a hidden little area tucked in Sun City Summerlin. My boyfriend took me here on our first date and it was perfect. You can tell the chef really took great pleasure in making his dishes. Lots of attention to details and very friendly staff. Dinner was wonderful! My boyfriend loved the lamb shank and I really enjoyed the chicken kabobs. We would have had a bottle of wine but we're headed to a show. I'm hoping he takes me here next week for our 1 year anniversary. It's a very romantic little restaurant.

I suggested the place cause I went for dinner the other night and I loved it !
But today everything was just over salty and way too much garlic !!
The two dishes with fish was just no way you can eat them, the garlic in the potatoes and two much oil in the orders ! The batter for the dish was just extremely salty, we actually weren't able to eat it, it was painful.
The zucchini chips just to much olive oil in it !
Spanakopita and pita was the only thing that I can said was good !!!
Lamb chops soaked in olive again and also the side roast potatoes with extremely over pounding garlic !
And we love garlic but it was just too much,
Giro platter was ok ! But not the best.
Really the whole experiences was a -10
From the other night !!!!

We live in North Las Vegas and they promptly deliver all the way out to us. Their gyro platter is phenomenal! Their Greek rice is amazingly seasoned and fluffy. While the lamb gyro plate is pricy at $20, it's worth it. Their grilled chicken gyro plate is awesome too but still $17. Their tzatziki sauce is fresh and delicious. We love this spot and will definitely be ordering again!
Delicious Food and Excellent Customer Service! Helen the owner was a gracious host. Highly Recommend.

Got a recommendation from a friend and he was spot on.  You walk in and think you are in Greece. 

Food was fantastic.  Service was fantastic.  The owner came from behind the counter to make sure everything was ok.  Hidden gem in Sun City.

Thanks for a wonderful Valentine's dinner! Great service, huge portions and THE FOOD!!! So yummy!!! Our party had  shrimp spaghetti, grilled shrimp and pastitsio. Each item was amazing and full of flavor. We will be back!
Love love love the food!! Real authentic Greek. Waiters & cook treated us so well. Highly recommend!

My husband, son & I had the most flavorful lamb & chicken gyro platter and the best tzatziki sauce.
Our meal came with a choice of salad or lemon chicken soup. We tried both and enjoyed both. 
The portions were perfect!

The server Kristina was awesome & the chef was very friendly too! First time here and it won't be the last. We'll be back very soon!

I went to eat there based on several recommendations from friends , I finally went there today and I can see why their recommendations came so highly !!! It was amazing , we love Greek food and have eaten at several Greek places around town,  this one by far is the best we have had. Everything was so fresh and you can tell very high quality ingredients.  We met the new owner and he said the feta cheese comes straight from Greece. We had the zucchini chips as an appetizer,  so good,  then a plate of feta cheese with olives and pita , amazing , my daughter and I had the moussaka, it was so flavorful and fresh , the flavors were on point and the servings are huge !! I also tasted the chicken salad , the tomatoes and cucumbers were so fresh and flavorful and in that dressing , home run . We loved it and will go back over and over , there are so many things I want to try , great job !!!!!!

Went for breakfast and as soon as we walked in we were cheerfully greeted and seated.  I ordered the moco loco, hubby ordered ham, eggs and potatoes. Our Server was pleasant and quick to attend to us. Food was delicious. The owner came out and spoke with us, and he was very nice.  We are going back for their lamb chops for dinner and can't wait!

I've been to most of the Greek restaurants in town, but I just discovered Mykonos today and it is definitely the best. Everything about this place felt very authentic and the food was superb. I would recommend it to anyone looking for Greek food in the Summerlin area and I will definitely be going back.
Amazing and authentic Greek cuisine. The service is also excellent. So happy to have found this place. Will definitely return next time I'm in Las Vegas.

I really enjoy this greek food, if you are looking for a great restaurant in summerlin you have found the right place to go!

I usually do the beef taco thing, not sure how to say or pronounce it but it's amazing. They have terrific service and their food preparation is just the best.
The food was really good, but all of it was pretty expensive. The service wasn't too good either. I would recommend going here if you have about two people and are splitting something.

Well, I live close by so I thought I'd give it a try on the way to the airport to pick someone up. I found the place nestled in between a couple of properties up for lease and I was the only one there save for a couple who were just finishing up. The service was polite and professional and the food? Well, soup was tasty and the taramasalata was a nice sized portion that went well with the tasty pita side. I ordered the calamari which were nice-sized portion and not deeply fried as they are in most other places across the valley. These were complimented with a spiced oil and lemon wedge. Enough for a main course. A bit pricey overall but the food and service were excellent.  I will be back when I have more time and may order from their extensive wine list. Thank you, Myknonos. I hope you endure like the island from whence you were named.
Fabulous food!! Wow!! Hidden gem!! Expensive menu! Best baklava I have tasted in Las Vegas (native NYer). Service was fantastic! I highly recommend a visit!! I'll be coming back for sure!!

My husband and I frequented Mykonos twice and both times delicious . We have tried the pork gyro -lamb gyro -spanakopita -shrimps in a tomato sauce -chicken skewers -Greek potatoes -side order of vegetables -authentic Greek salad -baklava -and kataifii dessert -& coffee too -which was of high quality.
Everything was so fresh and so tasty -this is the best Greek restaurant in Las Vegas .
The owners Dennis &  Helen are very warm attentive people . The restaurant is clean and tables are covered with linens -which is appreciated -such a nice touch -most restaurants have given up on elegant linens due to the cost of cleaning. Try this authentic Greek restarant you won't be disappointed ! Javier our waiter was just terrific ! The love and care you put into your business is obvious and it's appreciated!
Carolyn & Paul
Staff was incredible and food was excellent! Best calamari in town and you have to try the Baklava with black grapes!!!
Excellent delicious food!  Friendly and helpful staff. White tablecloths and hear decor.  The lamb and spanikopita was great.
Great service, great food, great ambiance. The chef came out and talked to us when they were out of the dish we ordered. Highly recommend and will definitely be back.

We stopped there for dinner the other night. The food was hot and tasty. The waitress was attentive. I just thought the portions were too big and too pricey. A small salad with a very large plate of pasta would have made me feel I was getting a meal. This restaurant is in a space where many restaurants have failed, it's within a senior community. Most seniors eat less and want to feel they're getting a good value.  They should rethink their menu.

OMG super amazing tucked away in a weird little spot in Sun City but the Greek food was super amazing and delicious Chef came over to talk to us and explain some of the dishes that we were eating at the end of my amazing meal I enjoyed a cup of Greek coffee I learned that you take the lemon rind twist it drop it in your coffee and it's amazing this spot is a definite must go

Came here by a friends recommendation and what a pleasant surprise, a real friendly family owned and operated Greek restaurant with real authentic Greek food.
I had a chance to meet the owners, Dennis and Hellen, a wonderful Greek couple with vibrant personality and full of energy 
I really enjoyed the moussaka and their dips were unbelievably delicious 
The spanakopita was also excellent and the baklava was just like my aunts Elizabeth's or maybe better
Keep up the good work 
Congrats

Amazing Greek food! Shrimp spaghetti is the best I've had and the pita can't be beat, our server was Roslin, definitely the best server we've had in a long time, fast, personable, and helpful with explaining the dishes, had the pleasure of meeting and talking to the owner Helen, very sweet lady besides the smell of alcohol on her breath which to me is unprofessional especially considering we can't have a drink because they don't have their license yet! Lol I'm sure she was trying to be helpful but she seemed to be trying to talk over Roslin when she was trying to get our order, again just unprofessional maybe waiting until the actual server is done getting our order and explaining the food before she goes to tables to chat would be better or more professional/respectful, the chef came and checked on us and made sure the food was to our liking overall great experience good job and welcome to the neighborhood

We don't mind sending $100 for dinner and wine but this with pricey menu, salad $10, Soup $10, over cooked Eggplant Parmigiana $18.50, Lamb special sold out, and all other lamb dishes $5 more, Wine $8 a glass, and long wait for our check, we won't be back.  .

The restaurant is nicely decorated in typical Mediterranean theme however a couple of things were puzzling first we ordered fries and asked for the creek dipping sauce and waiter looked me strangely and brought me ketchup then when I clarified it he said he didn't know what that was? Then my ordered the pan fried cod which was spongy and barely editable then we told the staff he offered to comp us a dessert? Poor customer service u are supposed to take off the bill duh

It's been a couple of months since I dined here (pesky "life" getting in the way) but I wanted to share my experience at Mykonos.  Overall I thought it was fine...I too had the gyro but did not run into the problems others did...and really enjoyed the spanakopita.  It was LARGE and full of spinach.  Really well done!

The downsides are what others have said: polite service, but very slow.  It was a little harder to take when there were only 2 other tables (of 2 people) at the time.  That, and the menu was somewhat limited than my experiences at other Greek restaurants in Las Vegas and California.  Of course, in a Greek place, you usually can't go wrong with a gyro, but if you don't like that, you'll feel a little painted in a corner here.

All that said, I'd be willing to visit again to see how things have changed next time I'm in town.

My husband and I live in Summerlin and husband wanted to try something different for dining so we found this place close to our house. I have to say I am astounded that this place has so many great reviews. we  went on a Saturday night and there were three tables dining.This is not the sign of a 4+ star restaurant. There were 2 people working the restaurant. One server and one cook. I can't understand how all these reviewers seem to talk about this "fantastic" service from the owner\manager whoever because the person serving all 4 tables this Saturday night was a poor example of service. After we sat down, we got water and menus and then were pretty much ignored for at least 10+ minutes. Finally we ordered, I asked some questions about the menu and the server was not impolite, but indifferent impersonal is the best way I can describe it. The easiest way for me to describe the food\atmosphere is this: Some things good, nothing fantastic. We liked about half of the stuff we ordered. Overpriced Dinner menu and not a lot of choices. Atmosphere was clean and pleasant. 
We were mostly ignored after we got our food. Husband got his drink filled one time and it was about 20 min to late. Then we waited again for her to come back and remove out plates, and she did not ask if we wanted dessert. I took a very small amount of food home and she brought back the bag to the table with no check and then disappeared. I think we seriously waited about another 15 minutes without seeing her in the restaurant at all. We finally came to the conclusion she could only have been outside smoking. finally she returned through the side door to bring us the check. After paying, we left out the front door to discover she was, in fact, out side sitting at a table on the sidewalk smoking a cigarette.

*Bumping up a Star*

Why:
-The service is personable
- Dishes are consistent 
- Easy to call in for take away
- Very clean restaurant 
- Plenty of parking 

Mykonos delivers what your looking for in Greek food! If your wondering, go try it out

We ordered from Mykonos over Eat24 app.  It started off bad when the delivery guy didn't ring the doorbell, he just started B A N G I N G on the front door.  Since we were in the front room watching TV that noise made hubby and I jump.  Hands over the bag of food and rushed away. (note NEVER give them the tip during payment of order, wait until they show up), he would have NEVER been given the tip I had prepaid for.

We ordered taramosalata, kokkinisto, greek romaine salad and chicken kabob plate.  My husband ate the salad, and I nibbled on the kokkinsto (big mistake, i've been sick since last night).  The rest of the food was unpalatable.  The taramasalata was SO salty, I spit out what was in my mouth.  My kokkinsto and the chicken kabob were bland and not cooked properly.  Kokkinsto especially is supposed to be slow cooked until the meat melts in your mouth, this was so chewy and tasteless.

The entire meal was horrible, one of the worst I have had in I can't even tell you how long.  We have crossed this place off of our list.

4 1/2 stars. Came in on a Tuesday evening and is located inside the Sun City retirement community in a small strip center. Parking was no issue because it seemed like a snowbird community and everybody bailed for the summer. 

I was greeted by the owner Helen who is Greek, sweet and friendly. When asked for a suggestion entrée since it was my first visit here, she suggested the whole red snapper - made Greek style. I also ordered a side salad and lamb gyros. The side salad arrived first which was refreshing on a hot day and contained  capers, tomatoes, bell peppers, cucumbers and a thick slice of cheese. The meal included pita bread & delish tzatziki and went perfect as a starter. The snapper and gyro arrived simultaneously  and the snapper was stuffed with dill, garlic & grilled to perfection. The fish was moist, flavorful and was delicious.  The gyros were solid too and it had chunks of lamb mixed with tomatoes, onions and lettuce  - It was another hit. For dessert we ended up sharing the baklava which was warm up and had a sauce on it. I'm use to the dry version of baklava and this was sweet. I think ice cream would have been a nice addition but it still cured my sweet tooth.

Overall, a great meal that didn't break the bank for solid quality this family run business offers. It was better than the Greek dinning experiences I've experienced in So. Cal.

if you've never tried or had a bad first time experience (like myself) with lamb then HOLD UP don't get discouraged just put on some nice comfortable (you're going to need room) clothes and head on over to Mykonos!!!! they prepare lamb in a way that if your eyes were closed and were to be fed you'd never guess by taste that it's LAMB! yes honest!! we had well done lamb chops, and lamb shanks plates .... Oh laaaawd have mercy bust all your chops!! it's played with HOMEMADE soft flavorful pita bread, pilaf rice and some green salad tossed with a light vinegar dressing! Thank you Mykonos for the most memorable lamb experience and much Aloha to chef FRANK!!

This is the second review I have written for this restaurant . I have always loved the food I have been served  and,even though I try different dishes, I have never been disappointed. I have brought many friends here and no one has ever left unsatisfied. One of the wonderful things about Helen and Dennis is their desire to satisfy anyone's needs. Have a special request, just call ahead and, if it is at all possible, they will try and make you happy. If you love authentic Greek food you must try this place. I think you will be happy you did so.

It does not get more authentic than this!!! Delicious Greek food and great service! Would recommend this place to everyone looking for great food in a quiet and inviting restaurant! But the overall shining plus about this place is QUALITY! In its food, environment, service, and its owners! Hard to find so I'm happy to have found this gem that puts quality first!!! 

Try the Spanakotiropita to begin with! Difficult to pronounce but AMAZING!!!

Today was our first day trying Greek food we ordered a pick up order on Yelp, and when we got there they didn't see the order so we ended up waiting about 10 minutes.  We ordered dolmades they were pretty tasty probably our favorite out of our whole order. We also got some grilled veggies they were a bit bland and had a bitter after taste afterwards, we also ordered 3 gyros  different meats they were pretty good.
From the Chef/Owner helping me personally select the bottle of wine... To the amazing rich flavors in every dish... I will be returning frequently

Stellar.  That best describes Mykonos. Everything is fabulous.  Spinach Pie, Lamb Gyros, Greek Salad and thenLemon Rice Soup is out of this world.  Always excellent service, great prices and their dinner specials for $9.50 is as good a value that you'll find anywhere.

This is a fabulous new Greek restaurant. The soup was the best chicken rice in Las Vegas. Also the best saganaki I've had in this town. The mousaka salad and then baklava all excellent. A definite must if you ever thought you like Greek food.

I'm not basing this on the food because I never had the opportunity to try it. But yelp says they are open today and rather I can confirm the establishment is closed down.... and not just Sunday, but everyday. Save your gas.

We went to dinner about 7:30 on a Thursday, and literally had the place to ourselves! Service was great, but again, we were the only ones in the place.

Had the calamari as an appetizer it was very good, tender, not chewy. I would have liked to have a little dipping sauce.... they serve it with lemon wedge and a light olive oil on the bottom of the plate. The pita bread was AMAZING!!
Entrees:
My husband had the lamb shank with potato, it was a nice portion with huge fresh cut french fry like potatoes. 
I had the Makaronia Kima, greek pasta with a ground beef tomato sauce and parsley. Its was very good, again.... portions are very good size..... flavor is very fresh. The meat sauce was very thick and rich.
A quality meal.... the location is a bit odd.... but, worth finding!
Awesome food and very good service. The chef even came out to talk to us. The waitress explained the menu. The lamb chops and chicken were to die for. We honestly loved it and will be back.
This was a really random stop. I found this place on Yelp. I found the service friendly and the food delicious.

I was happy to see a local Greek restaurant on the northwest side of town. The decor is nice and pleasant. They have a large selection of wine and food items. The staff is friendly and the owner is very attentive. I went over for lunch, which had a good selection. The prices for lunch are between 12-18 dollars which does not appear to be much of a discount from the dinner menu. I ordered the pork gyro which was served with some rice. This dish was very average and had an overly onion taste. 
I liked the fact that they carry fresh fish. I'm curious to come back and try their fish fry on Fridays. Although I was not thrilled with my lunch selection I think I would like to come back and give them a second try.

I was really excited to try this restaurant because of its high reviews.  I placed an order on Bite Squad and was so disappointed with the 1/2 chicken that was supposed to come with potatoes that sounded delicious.  Instead for the $18.50 for that dish, we received extremely dry chicken served with a huge pile of plain rice and some pita bread.  Very disappointing.

This seems to be a very authentic Greek restaurant that people really enjoy. Nevertheless, price is something I always consider when eating at restaurants.

Service was good. Food was delicious, but $15 for a Chicago style gyro and fries is a bit much. That's not what I'd consider a lunch special.

We went on a Sunday night and were one of two parties. Everyone was able to find a dish to their liking even with picky tastes. This is a true hidden gem. 
The food was high quality. My wife got the chicken souvlaki which was tender, lightly sliced and we'll complimented with a bit of yogurt. I the shrimp saganaki which was spicy and had a great complexity. Our friends got the pastitsio and the beef tips. The pastitsio disappeared in minutes. The beef tips well perfectly done with great flavors. 

The only down side was a slightly slow service. Perhaps she was giving us space but it took awhile to get attention. Our friends will be bringing coworkers. I highly recommend.

So coming to Mykonos was not my first choice while visiting family in Summerlin... I hate to admit it but I was actually quite surprised with the quality of food here.... Having dated my share of greek men I consider myself an expert at this point. 
They don't have booze which is always hard for me to wrap my head around but nothing a little hidden BYOB can't fix until they get their license.
We ordered a lot of the menu because I'm a brat like that and there wasn't anything I wouldn't order again. Come check it out. Seems more of a lunch place for me until they get that liquor license.

Oily, bland, and overpriced fish dishes.  Service was very friendly and appropriate.

We ordered 2 plates of entree, a whole fish and a plate of deep fried smelt. There was no seasoning in the batter of the smelt, given they're frozen, there was no flavor and it's served with fries (more oily food) $29.  Very dissapointing dish and unimaginative.  The whole fish was served on a plate full of olive oil and decorated with a few tomatoes.  Again, oily, and no flavor, mushy meat from being an over frozen fish. ($39)

At this price point, I will not be coming back.

Went in for lunch and had ordered the lamb gyros (also gyro meat available chicken, beef) sandwich special that came with fries and a soda fountain drink.
Quality was great and the lamb gyros meat was homemade and the flavor profile was awesome.
Tyaziki Sauce; cucumber garlic yogurt sauce was also homemade.
Portion size was exceptional along with the amount of fries that were also freshly cooked. Well worth the price.I will definetly be backed. Very affordable.

OMG if you like Greek food look no further! EVERYTHING is wonderful here! The Soup, Greek Salad, Greek eggplant Parmesan, chicken, lamb chops! We are from Chicago and their food is better than anywhere in Greek town! And don't leave without Baklava for dessert (Homemade)!!!
The Chef is truly Greek and the quality of food is the best we have ever had! Thank you Dennis and Helen! Mykonos is the place to come and enjoy real Greek food! Opa!!!

Sadly this place was sold, we have been back several times and the food and service is no longer the same! It's too bad!

3 stars and not 5 for food only because I went in and ordered the lunch salmon for $15 and waitress asked me what I wanted rice or...so I said salad,she did not tell me that salad is an additional $6 on top of the charge so I basically paid $22 for lunch salmon portion which I think is too much, and she didn't even apologized when I brought it up.  Food was great.
This was my first time enjoying Mykonos. We both had pasta that was both authentic and delicious.

The staff is friendly and very attentive...great service. The appetizers were very good, just didn't care for the taste / seasoning of the entrees...with our stomachs feeling a little upset afterward. We're well acquainted and enjoy many different ethnic cuisines, but this failed to meet our expectations after all the great reviews.

Had lunch here on sunday afternoon.
Quiet and very clean.
Ordered lunch special...lamb gyro, which was plentiful and tasted great.
Plenty of meat in the gyro.

Mykonos is pretty new. The waitress was friendly but i didn't get my drink refilled and it wasn't that busy. The restaurant was clean and comfortable. The food was wonderful. The avgolemono soup was delish. They have good lunch specials.

Great service, tasty food, nice location, what's not to like!  I had the braised beef tips, they were great!  My wife had the Greek salad, which was big enough for us both (made a great snack later).  Helen, the owner, waited on us and was a delight.  We'll be back, soon!

Items Selected:
Iced Tea
Melitzanosalata - Fire Roasted Eggplant Puree, Fresh Garlic, Extra Virgin Olive Oil, Greek Yogurt served with Pita
Hummus - Garbanzo Bean and Tahini Spread with Lemon Juice served with Pita
Sweet Beet - Sliced Sweet Beets Drizzled with Red Wine Vinegar and Extra Virgin Olive Oil, garnished with Greek Garlic Mashed Potato Dip and Greek Yogurt with Pita
Beef Tips - Braised in Red Wine and Tomatoes, served with Rich Tomato Sauce over Rice with Pita
Chef's Shrimp Heaven for Helen - Grilled Shrimp served with Sauteed Fruit and Citrus Sauce over a bed of Arugula, Greek Style Potatoes with Oregano
Mousaka - Baked Eggplant, Potatoes, Zucchini, Ground Beef, Tomato Sauce, Greek Feta Cheese, Cream Cheese, Parsley with Pita and Rice
Rice Pudding - Cinnamon
Karidopita - Walnut Cake with Cinnamon and Syrup
Baklava - Toasted Walnuts Baked in Phyllo Dough and finished with Orange Cinnamon Honey, Served with Sweet Grape Sauce
Kourabiedes - Greek Butter Cookies with Powdered Sugar

Located in Sun City Summerlin, the location in a small Strip Mall really no different than much of the dining in an age restricted community, Mykonos Greek Cuisine has received its fair share of praise from area residents since a recent change in ownership and dining as a trio in the dimly lit room this past Saturday the experience generally proved quite pleasant, though prices seem a bit precious even as portions trend big.

Admittedly unfamiliar with the area, reasons for anyone in their twenties or thirties to venture into this part of the valley few and far between, Mykonos 'strives to bring the culture and elegance of the Mykonos Islands here through Authentic Greek Foods and Service" and with a menu highly focused on Lamb, Beef, Mezze and Salads it seems odd that Guy Fieri is featured prominently on overhanging flatscreens while service is efficient if not a little overwhelming, an ever-present hand failing to clear extraneous dishes while at the same time incessantly trying to top-off Iced Tea.

At times showing its authenticity by way of subtleties of spelling, recipes or descriptions while at the same time featuring Early Bird Specials and several plates that seem "Americanized" for their typical clientele, those sitting down at Mykonos are well advised to investigate the collection of housemade spreads offered individually or by way of combination, the creamy Hummus and Melitzanosalata each priced at $7 with accompanying warm Pita while the $10.50 Sweet Beet Salad is an interesting presentation with sliced rounds encircling Garlic Mashed Potatoes with Olive Oil, the Red Wine Vinegar not particularly perceptible while the menu-described Greek Yogurt was nowhere to be found.

Really going all-out with the Pita, in reality a good thing as the warm housemade rounds are lightly tinged with herbs and near-perfect for scooping up any sort of sauce or spread, entrees arrived perhaps fifteen minutes after starters were presented and although the Mousaka was as authentic as any experienced it was actually the fall-apart Beef Tips in Red Sauce that were truly outstanding, the "Heaven for Helen" apparently a relic of prior ownership that was all-over-the-place in terms of its flavors, the handful of tail on shrimp largely forgettable while the admixture of warmed fruit over bitter greens was actually quite great.

Acknowledging that the $23.50 Shrimp would likely be *too* sweet for some, those familiar with Greek Desserts will be happy to know that Mykonos cuts no corners as relates to either of their three options and whether one fancies something as traditional as Rice Pudding or as dense as Karidopita the smart money is in a truly exemplary slice of housemade Baklava served in the cosmopolitan "island" style, bathed in sautéed Grape Sauce.

***Totaling over $120 after tax & tip, nearly a Strip-priced meal compared to other Greek Restaurants in Town, Mykonos Greek Cuisine takes a unique look at Mediterranean food in one of the city's least likely dining spaces, perhaps not worth "going out of the way for," but good for a change of pace.

Finally a quaint restaurant with authentic Greek food. Wood floor and white table cloths provide for a very nice atmosphere. Best yet the menu has a variety of Greek cuisine and the wine list is reasonably priced! I had the traditional gyro lunch plate and it was very delicious! Perfect for small groups and of course date night!

I was pretty pleased with the hummus and flatbread. It was incredibly delicious. Not really the other stuff I ordered (shrilled veggies) but it could've just been what I ordered. Every restaurant has their "thing". But DEFINITELY get the hummus.
Amazing food just like in Greece , great staff very friendly, good music . I love the shrimp saganaki , the octopus and the baklava .... I think i like it all

Gr8 neighborhood Greek family style restaurant.  Salads, appetizers, entrees are all de!icious.  The moussaka was fabulous w/the small Greek salad.  Greek wines available.  In Sun City Summerlin in a spacious decor w/a nice ambiance.  Baklava is yummy too.
Excellent food and service!!!  Be sure to try the octopus appetizer and the lamb!!!!  We will be back!!!!

What a gem in Sun City!! This is my favorite Greek restaurant. Every dish was off the charts great! I had the gyros lamb dinner and fava spread and my fiance had the moussaka dinner and Greek salad. Every bite was tender, juice and very flavorful.

Cute place in sun city... The have a special menu that's for 10 dollars that comes with soup or salad and rice ... We had the chicken gyro and the lamb gyro... The chicken was very tasty and the taziki was good too! The pita bread is very good as well ... The lamb is not freshly thinly sliced like I like it it looked pre made pre cut pieces unfortunately :( not a bad place but I have other Greek spots here in town more
The food here was amazing! And we prob had the most efficient and accommodating server. I believe his name was Jose(such a nice guy) the portion size are pretty big so be prepared! :)

Okay, I get it.  Mykonos is in Sun City, where the locals eat at 5:00 and are fast asleep by the time we decide it's time for dinner.  But c'mon, millenials, it's only a block off Lake Mead Blvd, and it's worth the trip from anywhere.  And if you decide to forgo the Early Bird dinner, as we do (which has recently been extended to 7:00 p.m. and the price lowered to an unbelievable $9.50), you won't have to contend with the likes of all those cranky seniors, ahem, showing up for the deal of the century.

I also get it that our second and latest visit was at 8:00 p.m. on a Monday, in the summer.  But this pretty and comfortable restaurant, with a chef-owner who is a talented chef, personable, and is passionate about his food and making his customers feel like valued guests, deserves to have the joint packed to the rafters every night.  Disclosure:  I'm not being paid for this rave review.  I think every customer gets the same delicious little cookies at the end of their meal; we did the first time, before I'd penned a word.  But I'd almost bet that at other restaurants you won't have an owner bring not one, but four different wine samples to taste before ordering a glass!  

But my greatest fear before moving to Vegas was not having cozy, privately-owned ethnic restaurants to go to, as I was accustomed to on the East coast.  Now my mission is to encourage others to take a break from the big chains and the ubiquitous sushi places, expand your culinary palates, and support your local businesses.  As I said the first time, this is not the same original owner, and the early reviews don't give a contemporary picture.  This is seriously good food.

I don't usually eat beef, but went for the Makaronia Kokkinisto, beef tips over spaghetti.  It was a huge portion, with a mountain of tender beef in a very thick fresh tomato sauce with a hint of cinnamon.  I will be enjoying it for more than one day to come.  My husband savored his Moussaka, which comes with a generous amount of those delicious lemon-enhanced roasted potatoes.

I could be wrong, but the prices seem to have increased since my last visit.  Probably to make up for the lowered EB cost, but there are discounts to be had.  Still, it's a good deal since, unless you're training for the Olympics, you'll have leftovers.

Good food. I enjoyed the Greek salad (Choriatiki). The beef tips were good but I would have liked a little more spice. The baklava is the best in town. Amazing service. Kind and always up for giving suggestions. I will be back for more.

My baptized name is Stavros and I grew up in that big fat Greek and Italian family. Take it from me,this place is a must visit! Great food! Big portions and awesome price! That is the hard part of Vegas... Finding a Greek restaurant. If you're nearby, stop in and meet Frank (the owner), he is the best! Service was fast and appropriate too! Great experience overall! 5 Stars!
